author: Jon Kamp
title: Florida Nursing Homes Get Temperature Requirements After Hurricane Deaths
text:
Florida Gov. Rick Scott signed two bills Monday setting climate requirements for elder-care facilities, something his office has been pushing for since a dozen patients died after their nursing home lost central air conditioning during last year’s Hurricane Irma.
Under the laws, the state’s nearly 3,800 nursing homes and assisted-living facilities must ensure the temperature stays at or below 81 degrees for at least 96 hours after a power outage.
